intro: Cyrtandra × chartacea, commonly known as the hybrid Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that often display vibrant colors. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. It is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in shaded, moist environments. Due to its hybrid nature, it exhibits a range of morphological variations depending on its parent species.
